data.tastingNotes:
Dark ruby in color, with a dark purple rim that shows its youth. A nose of pronounced fresh red fruits (strawberriers, rapsberries, red-currants) and bright perfumeof black cherry. When swirled, jammy notes develop.
Concentrated, juicy and fresh succulent tanins. Keypoint ; made upon totally ripe, handpicked and selected fruit.

A bright dark wine shot through with highlights. The noticeable red fruit in the nose is accompanied by aromas of cinnamon and spice. The mouth is full of jammy red fruit (strawberry), rounded and well-balanced and finishes on notes of spice (vanilla, pepper).
The youthful tannins mean it will last quite a while.

A bright dark wine shot through with highlights. The noticeable red fruit in the nose is accompanied by aromas of cinnamon and spice. The mouth is full of jammy red fruit (strawberry), rounded and well-balanced and finishes on notes of spice (vanilla, pepper). The youthful tannins mean it will last quite a while.
Solid, with a bodied and fresh style, as well as floral and darker berry fruits. Fine, tight tannin and good length.

data.productName: Carmen Stevens Angels Selection Chenin Blanc 2018
data.tastingNotes: This is a clean refreshing unoaked style of Chenin Blanc. The lightness of colour is indicative of an early picking. A lime fresh nuances greets you, this flows to baked apple and pear expression. Palate entrance is a mixture of lime and salt/ minerality flavours followed by the baked fruit that fills the palate.  The weight of this wines makes it inviting and very flowy on palate. The length of the wine is enhanced by the salty impression that the wine leaves on the palate. A beautiful wine with lots of finesse. A well balanced wine showing all the attributes of a well-made Chenin Blanc.

My Rebel Shiraz has a lovely purple red colour.  
The nose exhibits lovely red berry and plummy fruit, with lovely spicy overtones.  
The palate is simply a mouthful of flavour!!!  Ripe and generous berry fruit fill the mid-palate, with a lovely savoury, spicy tannin finish.  This wine is super more-ish!!!

Bright red color with purple hues. Enticing aromas of red fruit, cherries and plum. Medium bodied with a velvety texture and a long, persistent finish, revealing its full potential. Ideal to pair with a Juicy Ribeye or any kind of beef.

THis is a typical expression of Muscat. It has lovely ripe tropcial aromas of dried mango, and pineapple together with some delicate floral notes. The rich palate is viscous and retains a beautiful long finish.

This is lovely because it carries both a lightness and fruit structure. Together they come to bring drinkability to the wine. Plenty of stonefruit characters but a lift of citrus helps to keep focus and a refreshing nature to the wine.

data.productName: Rod Easthope Hawke's Bay Merlot Cabernet Franc 2015
data.tastingNotes: Vivid fruit aromas of red plum, and blackcurrant fuse with violet like characters and oak derived sandalwood like spice.  On the palate graphite like fruit tannins meld seamlessly with oak tannin and an intense core of fruit for a flavoursome and texturally enticing experience.

Medium high red ruby colour.
Fruity and intense aromes, strawberries, red fruits,...
Smooth and easy drinking mouthfeeling, juicy.

Fresh berries, cherries black pepper and soft spices with floral and earthy tones.  The mouth is deep and round in the same time, more structured than powerful. The small and fine tannins are yet integrated, building a precise architecture, and are still present in a long finish made of spicy berries.

Lively deep red, with a violet rim, fills the nose with small dark and red berries, as well as intense flowers, like violets. It's taste is mouth filling, slightly astringent like dark berries sometimes are, and its minerality (saltiness) is clearly perceivable and long lasting. It's round and gentle side stays wit you for a very long time after last sip, like a cozy evening with good friends talking about nice stuff: the good feeling stays with you for hours!

Wonderful citrus notes with components of crushed stone and bright apple. Beautiful depth and texture at 12.0% alcohol.

A few notes on Albariño from Wine Folly:

"Albariño is a wine that deserves extended sniffing in your glass. It has a dramatic aromatic intensity as a result of the higher levels of two aromatic compound groups called terpenes and thiols. Expect aromas of lemons, limes, pear, grapefruit, honeysuckle, nectarine, and occasionally orange zest and beeswax, supported by subtle smells of freshly wetted granite and Thai basil when sniffing your glass. When you taste Albariño, youll instantly delight in its mouth-watering acidity, somewhat weighty mid-palate, saltiness, and long tingly finish that often has a subtle bitter note (almost like grapefruit pith)."

Floral with powdered sugar and rosewater that entice on the nose. Notes of lemon, pansies and gardenia add richness and intrigue to the palate. Fresh, zesty, clean and zippy describe the personality of this vibrant and very representative example of Moschofilero. Light but not a pushover and certainly with plenty of character. Pretty, potent and very spring like  perfect for a spring brunch.

On the palate the red fruits are strawberries and raspberries. You get plums and forest fruits too, top quality fruit in this. It becomes more savoury after with licorice hints, herbs, tobacco and a slight pepper spice to finish. The tannins are strong but not invasive to the balance of the wine and its mildly acidic. There is a long finish to round it all off.

A complex and full-bodied chardonnay. This wine was fermented and aged sur-lie in Frenh oak barriques for 9 months prior to bottling. Light straw in color with a greenish tint. The nose entices with grapefruit, apple and nutty aromas. On the palate a pleasant creaminess underlined with citrus notes is prevalent. The wine ends refreshingly dry, with a pleasant lingering aftertaste.

data.productName: Rod Easthope Hawke's Bay Moteo Syrah Viognier 2014

data.tastingNotes:
Colour: Deep and bright violet red.
Aroma: blackberries and juicy raspberries, sweet flowers and an elegant toast touch. 
Flavour: juicy and fruity, medium body with friendly tannins given by to the altitude of the Andes, that bring it a great lively finish.
crisp Chablis, with a citrus and mineral edge

We bottle and release the Chenin as early as we can post fermentation. This wine is 100% stainless steel fermented, and it sees no influence of oak. Early on in it's life there are strong citrus notes, lemon zest, limeaide, orange marmalade and as the wine ages in bottle it shifts to more tropical notes, banana, melon, pineapple.

A deep, inky red with inviting aromas of blackcurrant, violet and rooibos tea. Powerful in structure yet with an incredibly rich and seamless texture, this full-bodied wine shows ripe cocoa-powder tannins and flavours of camphor, cinnamon, black olive tapenade and dark berry fruit. A long finish with tannins building nicely on the back palate yet remaining fleshy and approachable.

Dark, purple red colour. Full bodied. Mulberry, ripe fruit,  with integrated
oak, firm young tannins with full aftertaste.
SAME AS PREVIOUS VINTAGE

Bright and pure on the nose, showing freshly cut hay and white pepper notes. Lively and fresh on the palate with lots of citrus flavours and a round finish. Thanks to the high-altitude vineyards where the Verdejo grapes are grown, the wine reflects the aromas of the grape variety.
na
Intense aromas of ripe forest berries and raspberry leaf are complimented by underlying gamey flavour. It has well-integrated tannins and great balance with good texture and persistent finish.

data.productName: Simpsons of Servian Blanc de Blancs Beora Reserve 2016
data.tastingNotes: Soft nougat and marzipan nose with citrus balance, some autolytic development and a smooth, rich mouthfeel.
It has fruity and floral aromas, with refreshing lime and grapefruit flavor

data.productName: Katie Jones La Gare Old Vine Carignan 2016
data.tastingNotes:
A delicious  rich full bodied red wine made from the rather bad boy grape of the Languedoc - carignan.

For a long time looked down upon for its massively high yields - old vine carignan with very low yields has proved that it can make an elegant refined style of wine.

data.productName: Matt Parish Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
data.tastingNotes: Classic Napa Cab - Rich & Smooth!  Inviting dark red purple appearance, plenty of rich ripe fruit on the nose and palate - dark berries, blackberries, licorice and plums.  Layers of toasty mocha oak characters with a hint of vanilla and spice. Silky smooth texture that gives the wine a moorish character.

GOLDEN COLOR WINE WITH GREENISH FLASHES.VERY INTENSE AROMA WITH HINTS OF PEACH,ORANGE AND GRAPEFRUIT CITRUS.
WELL-BODIED WITH A PERSISTENT FINISH AND GOOD ACIDITY.

My 2017 Rebel Riesling has a pale straw colour.  The nose has lovely floral characters and lemon/lime citrus notes.  The palate is dry, crisp and refreshing, with crunchy green apple and citrus fruit flavours, and excellent length.
